remarks.para: May be inoperative extended or retracted.

note.para: Associated Reverse thrust is limited to idle when inoperative retracted.
The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: When selecting reverse thrust, pull all reverse levers up to the normal interlock position and apply reverse thrust as required when the operative interlocks release.

note.para: If interlock is inoperative extended (released), there will be no physical stop for that reverse thrust lever when it is pulled up to the interlock position. The EEC will still protect the engine by not letting reverse thrust increase above idle until the thrust reverser sleeves are sufficiently deployed.

numlitem.para: When selecting reverse thrust, pull all reverse levers up to the interlock position. When the reverse interlocks release, apply symmetrical reverse thrust as needed for stopping requirements. Full reverse thrust on three engines is available if conditions required it.

note.para: If interlock is inoperative retracted, it will not be physically possible to move the reverse thrust lever beyond reverse idle, even when the reverser sleeves are fully deployed.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Takeoff on cluttered or icy runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ REVERSE THRUST LEVER INTERLOCK INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
